messages.message:
Hey @avi @Varun Jain

Some general feedback on chatbots, it would be really useful to be able to create your chatbot with documents / websites / whatever and this be the core ‘static’ knowledge base.

Then in the chatbot you can then upload a new document to allow you to compare and query contents of this against the ‘static’ knowledge base.

Example in insurance, maybe all the policy data is added to the knowledge base, but then you upload an claim to the chatbot to help understand if the claim is valid.

Is this something we’ve thought of?
Yup! [EPD-1715] Allow users to upload document into the chat context - Jira (atlassian.net) (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1715)

I set up a customer call around a similar use case — the Chatbot knowledge base contains underwriting guidelines, and underwriters upload the policy before sending back to the broker to confirm that it is compliant. This is relevant because guidelines are constantly in flux.
